intro: Oxydectes hilarii, commonly known as the Happy Bells, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showing adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat. Oxydectes hilarii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens.
